definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
male/Baron, lowest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/CL:個|个[ge4]

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

pinyin: da4 nan2 zi3 zhu3 yi4 zhe3

sentences.english: Betty had no idea what male chauvinism was.
sentences.chinese: 貝蒂不知道大男子主義是怎麼回事。

sentences.english: He's just another male chauvinist who is jealous of his wife's success.
sentences.chinese: 他只是另一個大男子主義者，嫉妒妻子取得的成就。

sentences.english: Before a woman, man likes to unfold himself in men's way. Sometimes there must be androcentrism.
sentences.chinese: 這樣纔像個男人，所以大男子主義有時侯是必需的。

sentences.english: Yes, that's right. One of the biggest turn-offs is the male who is a chauvinist.
sentences.chinese: 最令女人討厭的就是男人的大男子主義。

sentences.english: I have been a male chauvinist pig, I admit it.
sentences.chinese: 我承認我是個大男子主義者。

sentences.english: She knows of Nick's chauvinistic reputation and his star status at the agency.
sentences.chinese: 她也素聞尼克的大男子主義及其在公司的顯赫地位。

definition: lit. eats soft food, but refuses hard food (idiom)/amenable to coaxing but not coercion
in order of arrival/first come, first served
lit. going round the curves and skirting the corners (idiom)/fig. to speak in a roundabout way/to equivocate/to beat about the bush
paying more attention to a lover than friends (idiom)/to value sex over friendship
erhua variant of 爺們|爷们[ye2 men5]
